attributes.action: Allow ALL Asthmatics who take steroid inhalers to be included in Vaccine Group 6
attributes.additional_details: Asthmatics are clearly vulnerable to serious health risks compared to healthy adults, which is why we’re offered the flu jab each year. The majority of us who have non-severe asthma take long term, steroid based medication to manage our condition. Catching Covid could make us very ill compared to non-asthmatics. We need to be prioritised alongside steroid tablet users.
attributes.background: We want all Asthmatics who use steroid inhalers and who are eligible for the flu jab each year to be included in COVID-19 Vaccination priority group 6. We are clinically vulnerable and have chronic lung conditions and we are at risk so should be prioritised over healthy adults.

rejection.details:
Decisions about who is clinically extremely vulnerable is a clinical decision, not the responsibility of the Government or House of Commons.

We could accept a petition calling for people who are judged at moderate risk (clinically vulnerable) from Covid-19 to be given increased priority in the Covid-19 vaccination programme, if that is what you want to happen.
